title: Introduction
text:
Early preview v0.1
Deep dive into health data architecture, data flows, and data capabilities across NHS England, through detailed schematics and explainers. This is an early proof of concept and a ‘living document’ that will be continually updated. Work is offered open source, under MIT license. Source files found in the Github repository. Feedback and collaboration are invited.
Previous work in mapping data flows found in Zhang, Morley et al., 2023 and Data Insights UK. This last work, conducted to support recommendations of Better, Broader, Safer 2022, was focused on high-level but comprehensive understanding of what individual flows existed (est. 60,000 in one year) and who was extracting and using data. The new work, hosted here, is focused on a cross-section of systems, technical architectures, and extraction mechanisms, that are key to informing feasibility and gap anlysis for technical data programmes.

title: National Schematics
text:
Early preview v0.1
The diagram below illustrates data flows that meet the following criteria.

On a national scale (spanning all NHS regions)
Occur electronically (data is managed electronically and systematically collected via API)
Managed systematically (the same documented process is reproduced across all extractions and transfers).

Each category of data flows can be toggled. These, and source systems, are described in subsections. The diagram may take 30 seconds to load. Best viewed in desktop/laptop computer web browser, and in full screen.
